elements.name: Auftrag
elements.title: In this exercise, you will find reworded obligations arising from mandatory and relatively mandatory legal provisions. Find the correct wording in each case.

elements.name: Frage 1
elements.title: Which wording is correct?
choices: The employer may deploy the apprentice for work that is not related to the apprenticeship occupation.
The learner must carry out work for the employer that is not related to the apprenticeship and interferes with training.
The employer must deploy the learner for work that is related to the apprenticeship and does not interfere with training.
elements.correctAnswer: The employer must deploy the learner for work that is related to the apprenticeship and does not interfere with training.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Which wording is correct?
choices: The employer can release the learner for free courses at the vocational college.
The employer must release the learner for free courses at the vocational college, but can claim a wage deduction.
The employer must release the learner for free courses at the vocational college without deducting wages.
elements.correctAnswer: The employer must release the learner for free courses at the vocational college without deducting wages.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Which wording is correct?
choices: The employee must carry out orders for the employer carefully and safeguard the legitimate interests of the employer.
The employee may carry out orders for the employer as he sees fit.
The employee may carry out orders for the employer and may pursue his own interests.
elements.correctAnswer: The employee must carry out orders for the employer carefully and safeguard the legitimate interests of the employer.

elements.name: panel1
elements.title: In this exercise, you will find reworded obligations arising from mandatory and relatively mandatory legal provisions. Find the correct wording in each case.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Which wording is correct?
choices: The employer may grant the apprentice a maximum of five weeks' vacation per apprenticeship year.
The employer must grant the apprentice at least five weeks' vacation per apprenticeship year.
The employer must grant the apprentice at least three weeks' vacation per apprenticeship year.
elements.correctAnswer: The employer must grant the apprentice at least five weeks' vacation per apprenticeship year.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Which wording is correct?
choices: The employer must grant the learner at least twelve hours of consecutive rest per day.
The employer must grant the learner at least eight hours of consecutive rest per day.
The employer must grant the learner at least six hours of consecutive rest per day.
elements.correctAnswer: The employer must grant the learner at least twelve hours of consecutive rest per day.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Which wording is correct?
choices: The employer must guarantee the learner at least six hours of work per day (including breaks).
The employer must guarantee the learner a maximum daily working time of twelve hours (including breaks).
The employer must guarantee the learner a maximum daily working time of nine hours (including breaks).
elements.correctAnswer: The employer must guarantee the learner a maximum daily working time of twelve hours (including breaks).
